alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; North Central Mountains; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Plateau; Sandia and Manzano Mountains; Sangre de Cristo Mountains; Upper Rio Grande Valley and Lower Chama River Valley; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 16 at 3:58AM MDT until April 18 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR ALL OF NORTHERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS WITH AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Tuesday through Thursday continue to advertise a prolonged period of widespread critical fire weather conditions with strong westerly winds, low humidity and an unstable atmosphere. While winds will diminish after sunset, overnight humidity recovery will be poor nearly areawide, with most areas only recovering to 20 to 35 percent. Conditions do not look to improve Wednesday or Thursday. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...All of northern and central New mexico below significant snowpack from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Westerly 20 to 35 mph with gusts to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...9 to 14 percent, except higher in the mountains. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
